ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Everything relevant to introductory atmospheric science: convection, general circulation, radiative transfer, microphysics. Lots of applying physics to the atmosphere. Good practice for that.
Derivation of physical phenomena, large scale systems
This class teaches students about the vertical structure of the atmosphere, radiative balance (between the sun and Earth), convection, and how weather functions on Earth.
Better understanding of processes that govern weather and climate
Fundamental knowledge of atmospheric science and geophysical fluid dynamics
I learned a lot about the dynamics of atmospheric flow and climate patterns
Knowledge of atmospheric and ocean sciences
A basic understanding of convection and the Earth's wind systems.
This course taught me about atmospheric processes and concepts in a both application and conceptual frameworks.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: Very understanding professor, reasonable workload, and reasonable difficulty of exams/problem sets. I think doing practice problems in the lecture would help improve understanding.

I think this class needs a TA; there was a lot of material and the lectures moved quite fast, but prof. Lora did not have a lot of time for office hours. The content is interesting and the book is good.

Strengths: This course had great organization and strong lectures. I enjoyed lecture every day and found the content to be interesting and relevant. 

Weaknesses: The course was primarily difficult when it departed from the main textbook. The departures were often to add more depth for more advanced topics, so the lack of continuity led to some difficulties when working on problem sets and exams.

Strengths: interesting content, small class environment was nice
Weaknesses: not a lot of feedback and not a lot of office hours. ULAs would have been very helpful.

Strengths: the course material and textbook greatly overlap, so it is helpful to have a second resource. Professor Lora also makes the classroom feel more like a discussion, so it is easy to ask clarifying questions. I also appreciate that Professor Lora placed a stronger emphasis on understanding the overall concepts versus memorizing everything. Exams were open note. 

Weaknesses: sometimes the course concepts are difficult to understand.
It is well organized around student learning in terms of the order of information presented.
The course was outlined with great topics, sometimes some of the explanations could've been more clear.

The problem sets were really reasonable and well paced. The lectures, on the other hand, were a little slow paced in that we spent a lot of time on the same things and then rushed through the other things as a result. So I feel like there is room to improve the pace and depth of the lectures.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes if you are interested in climate/atmospheric science. A good foundation for that!

The material is interesting and there arent a lot of problem sets but I found this to be one of the harder classes Ive taken for the applied math major. There is so much material and derivations in class move fast. Exams were hard but curved. Ok lecturing.
Yes, even if you have no background in EPS, if you are experienced with calculus and familiar with some thermodynamics, this course is an excellent way to apply those skills.
Good content, structure made learning challenging at times
Yes, I gained a fundamental understanding of atmospheric science. The concepts taught are important to climate science.
It is one of the only courses that covers this topic in this way and is one of the core EPS classes
Yes
I would recommend this course because I think it's really good for understanding the basic of weather.

extras.title: EPS 322 01/EPS 522 01 - Physics of Weather and Climate
